Thank you, New Hampshire, for letting me spend Labor Day with you! Let’s dream big, fight hard, and win together. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EDfy2KnWwAEDu5c.jpg

Gun control doesn’t work. Look at Chicago. Disarming law-abiding citizens isn’t the answer. Stopping violent criminals—prosecuting & getting them off the street—BEFORE they commit more violent crimes is the most effective way to reduce murder rates. Let’s protect our citizens. https://twitter.com/breitbartnews/status/1168272622209163270 QT @BreitbartNews At least 25 people were shot, seven fatally, during the first half of Labor Day Weekend in Democrat-controlled Chicago. https://www.breitbart.com/politics/2019/09/01/25-shot-7-killed-during-first-half-labor-day-weekend-chicago/

My advice to every student beginning a new school year:

There will be people who tell you it can’t be done: don’t listen to them. Reject false choices and know that you can do anything if you work for it. Make good friends and seek out mentors.

I hear a lot in the corporate media about how Medicare for All is just "too expensive."

You know what is too expensive? Paying $28,000 a year for health insurance – the average for a family of four.

That is really damn expensive! And it's going to end under Medicare for All.

I’d be happy to sit down & visit next week about uniting to stop gun violence & about the Constitution. If we can have a civil & positive conversation—in the spirit of 1 Peter 4:8 as you suggest—despite our political differences, that might help resolve the discord in our Nation. https://twitter.com/alyssa_milano/status/1168397523951579136 QT @Alyssa_Milano I’d love to come in and meet with you on the gun issue and many other issues that include life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness, @tedcruz and also, 1 Peter 4:8.

I’ll be in DC next week. We can live-stream the meeting so the American people can hear your bullshit 1st hand. https://twitter.com/tedcruz/status/1168310869425577989

Almost half. That’s how many Americans can’t cover an unexpected $400 emergency w/ savings & how many workers make less than $15/hour. Workers are stuck & wages are stagnant b/c of corporate practices like subcontracting & no poach clauses. Let’s put an end to them.

RT @fema #Dorian is a powerful storm. Know your risks & be ready:

🌊 On the coast: life-threatening storm surge, extreme winds. Evacuate if local officials tell you to!

⛈️ Inland: Flooding, high wind & power outages are possible. Be ready to shelter & sign up for weather alerts. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EDdk2dYXoAE-nUB.jpg

The Trump Admin’s cruel & inhumane plan to deport people with serious medical conditions must be *fully* reversed. USCIS must tell the world unequivocally that in our compassionate America, the seriously ill who request humanitarian relief will never be targeted for deportation.

Heartbroken over the news out of Santa Cruz Island. I’m grateful for the heroic first responders and rescuers who are working tirelessly on the scene to ensure every person is found. DO NOT make decisions based on past storms

I support the right of public educators to join a union, and bring the fight for student needs and better pay to cities and state capitals across America. It’s about time our teachers got the support they deserve to teach the next generation of leaders.

There is love and joy in the world. https://twitter.com/cbsnews/status/1168501564245467139 QT @CBSNews PURE HAPPINESS: This 16-year-old girl was disappointed that she had to miss a Jonas Brothers concert because she's undergoing chemotherapy treatment. But then, she got a surprise right in her hospital room ❤️  https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jonas-brothers-hershey-band-surprises-fan-at-hospital-after-she-had-to-miss-concert-for-chemotherapy/?ftag=CNM-00-10aab7e&linkId=73008395&linkId=73010655 http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1168501323798654977/img/HaUBAZIkjxz3F7Sy.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1168501323798654977/vid/320x320/4Mfg6utAHiZrnipE.mp4?tag=13

Right now, corporate profits are at an 85-year high, but wages are at their lowest in over 60 years. Instead of investing in workers, companies are benefiting shareholders w/ stock buybacks. Let’s ensure that if companies have the profits to pay investors, workers get a cut, too.

Every person in this country must have the right to:

-A decent job and a living wage
-Quality health care
-A complete education
-Affordable housing
-A clean environment
-A secure retirement

It's time for a 21st Century Economic Bill of Rights.

RT @JemarTisby Banners on Chicago's 1st #LaborDay in 1885 read:
"Do unto others as you would have others do unto you”; “We do not ask for charity, but simple justice”; and “Eight hours for work, eight hours for rest, eight hours for recreation.”
⁦@heathwcarter⁩  https://blog.oup.com/2015/09/origins-labor-day-marches-1880s-chicago/

This campaign is about standing with working people everywhere against corporate greed. This Labor Day, join a #BernieSolidarity action near you! Find one at http://map.berniesanders.com

I began my campaign in Lawrence, MA, where textile workers—mostly women, nearly all immigrants—went on strike after their pay was cut. They put aside their differences and fought together for a better life. This #LaborDay, thank unions for:

-weekends
-8-hour workdays
-a minimum wage
-paid overtime
-breaks during work
-the right to strike
-child labor laws
-workplace safety standards

The labor movement taught us that when people stand together, they don’t have to beg. They can win.

This #LaborDay, it’s critical we remember that labor has lifted up working Americans. It’s because of them we have better wages, safer working conditions, and a five-day workweek. When I’m in the White House, workers won’t have to fight alone.

Unions built the middle class—and unions will rebuild the middle class. If we want more good American jobs, then we need stronger unions and more power in the hands of the people. I’m proud to be fighting alongside our unions. #LaborDay http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EDdo1HYWkAA2NBo.jpg

Today we remember and honor those who fought for workers’ rights—for fair wages, decent benefits, safe working conditions, the right to unionize and more. We know this fight is far from over and we will not rest until we achieve economic justice for all Americans. #LaborDay

Eight million people work two or more jobs just to survive in the world's richest country. Their stories show us an economy of, by, and for the 1%.

It's time to stand up, fight back, and build a society where America's working class can live in dignity. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/01/opinion/working-two-jobs.html

Donald Trump abandoned the labor movement because he knows that unions are the last line of defense against the greed of his billionaire friends. When we are in the White House, we will double union membership in America. Happy Labor Day from New Hampshir https://www.pscp.tv/w/cD1kKDMyNzU3OTl8MWRSS1pMQnJRQXdKQu-Lvw5MSeip2t6J6tkmnEO8frKbAcCXkPwO0Tqmv8Xi

By joining a union, my grandfather was able to get better wages and benefits, break my family out of poverty and enter the middle class. Today I celebrate #LaborDay knowing I wouldn't be here if it weren't for the right to organize—we must continue this fight for workers' rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EDeAlZOXYAED0pA.png https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1168543675502252032/vid/320x320/QvSCmCJ9HVJv2U2B.mp4?tag=13

What is a worker’s line of defense? It is the right to strike.

It is time to ensure that federal workers have the same rights  as private sector workers, including the right to strike. #LaborDay

I’ve been a champion of labor throughout my career. As San Francisco’s DA, I prosecuted companies that stole worker wages and put their safety at risk. As CA’s Attorney General, I fought to defend public sector labor unions against attacks. I’ll continue that fight as president.

If you were born in 1973, the median wage went from $17 to $19 an hour over your lifetime. That’s it. Two bucks in 45 years. 

The top 1%'s annual income tripled: $480K to $1.45 million.

That's why we need a political revolution. To build an economy for all of us—not the 1%. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EDe0oxfWwAE7ZME.jpg

This #LaborDay, as we remember and thank those who battled for fair wages and safe working conditions, we must recognize that the fight is not over. We cannot rest until every worker in America has the rights, dignity and pay they deserve.

RT @FLSERT Storm surge is often the greatest threat to life and
property from a hurricane. It poses a significant threat for
drowning. A mere six inches of fast-moving flood water
can knock over an adult. If you have been ordered to evacuate, it is vital that you leave immediately. https://twitter.com/NHC_Atlantic/status/1168580218358910976 QT @NHC_Atlantic Here's a look at the 11 am @NHC_Surge forecast:  Water could reach the following heights above ground somewhere in the indicated areas if the peak surge occurs at the time of high tide:  
Lantana to the Savannah River: 4 to 7 ft
North of Deerfield Beach to Lantana: 2 to 4 ft http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EDehgMOU4AEG78U.jpg

Every #LaborDay I’m reminded of her, but on this one especially, I’m thinking of Natasha, a server I knew who passed away suddenly in July.
